didoss@... wrote:

> For some 'higher up': if I were interested in writing this code, what is 
> the process for that?

Write it and publish it on a web site. <opinion>I don't think it belongs 
in JUnit. It's an extension, and not part of the framework.</opinion>

Unfortunately, the JUnit test runners are not meant to be whiz-bang -- 
they just run tests for the simple case, and that's all they'll ever be. 
If you want to use a more extensible test runner, try JUnit-addons test 
runner. Either that, or build your own and donate it to the community.

I admit that the JUnit-addons test runner should, for many reasons, be 
the standard JUnit test runner, but it ain't. <shrug />
--
